content:
# Factorio Agent Report (Steps 8-15)

## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Electricity Generator at position (-5.0, 2.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, -0.5)
- Boiler at (-5.0, 2.5) (now operational with coal and water supply)
- Steam engine at (0.5, 6.5)
- Pipe network connecting offshore pump to boiler (water)
- Pipe network connecting boiler to steam engine (steam)
- Small electric poles at (0.5, 8.5) and (3.5, 9.5)

### Water Storage System
Consists of:
- Storage tank at (6.5, 6.5) (replacement for problematic tank)
- Attempted connections from offshore pump (not fully connected)

### Chemical Plant Complex at position (6.5, 12.5)
Consists of:
- Chemical plant (currently set to produce sulfur)
- Storage tank at (3.5, 12.5)
- Water pipe connection from offshore pump
- Power connection attempt (currently failing)
- Missing petroleum gas input

## ERROR TIPS

### Persistent fluid connection issues
- Verify all connection points are properly aligned between source and target entities
- Ensure pipe networks are continuous without gaps between endpoints
- Check fluid types match between connected entities (water vs petroleum gas)

### Power distribution problems
- Confirm all power poles are properly connected in a continuous network
- Verify steam engine is actually connected to the power grid
- Check power coverage extends to all buildings needing electricity

### Chemical plant operation issues
- Ensure all required input fluids are available (water and petroleum gas)
- Verify power is properly reaching the chemical plant
- Check recipe requirements match available inputs

### Entity placement validation
- Always verify target positions are placeable before attempting placement
- Check for water or other terrain obstacles when placing buildings
- Consider building dimensions when selecting placement locations

### Assertion failures
- Verify entity statuses before making assertions
- Add proper error handling for cases where assertions might fail
- Check warning messages on entities for operational issues
